text: when that hour is wasted cause installing a cli requires brew, and brew needs command line tools from xcode :face_palm::skin-tone-2:  Thankfully the hs cli does not require this lol
rinse and repeat every 3-6 months when a new xcode comes out lol
Added M1 bonus… Not realizing when your terminal (and thus brew) is running in Rosetta compatibility mode and trying to compile the x86 version of a package and failing
Yeah, I stopped using Hyper as a terminal after that. Since it’s Electron-based, it wasn’t running as a native M1 app.

This is a pretty interesting question from a HubSpotter on our community:

> _How is operations development handled at your company?_
Would be curious to know everyones answers. I know in my past experiences at companies it was more of a “Job to be done” type thing instead of a job for someone in particular. Feel free to weigh in on the post below!
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/128172-OpsLife/Operations-Developer-A-Job-Position-or-a-Job-To-Be-Done/td-p/471826>
